snippet: An appeal by the online booking site Airbnb resulted in a ruling from a city regulatory board that a man, Nigel Warren, did not violate laws on short-term rentals.
abstract: New York City's Environmental Control Board overturns a $2,400 fine paid by East Village resident Nigel Warren, who rented room in his two-bedroom apartment to a tourist for a few days in 2012 via online booking site Airbnb; board rules that Warren did not violate city regulations on short-term rentals.
lead_paragraph: An appeal by the online booking site Airbnb resulted in a ruling from a city regulatory board that a man, Nigel Warren, did not violate laws on short-term rentals.

headline.main: Tenant’s Fine for Renting to Tourist Is Overturned
headline.print_headline: Tenant’s Fine for Renting To Tourist Is Overturned
